page.title: 14ALTON CHURCHES AND SCHOOLS
page.content: Religion plays a vital part in the life of Alton.There are three churches:the Church of England,named after St Peter,the Roman Catholic Church of St John the Baptist and the Methodist Chapel.Religion and education are closely linked in Alton.The Castle School,a boarding school in the castle itself,and the day school within the castle boundaries,belong to the Catholic Church.St PeterÂ£s School in the High Street is a Church of England School.St PeterÂ£s is a First School with 55 children aged 5-9,while St JohnÂ£s Primary has 68 children aged 4-11.Both schools have 3 teachers including the Headteacher. The Castle School is a boarding school run by the nuns from the convent.There are 100 children aged from 4-13.Children come to the Castle School from all over the world.
